PCR reactions were cycled in the following sequence 40 times. the final cycle was followed by an extension step at 72°C for 10 min. the amplified PCR products were separated on a 2% agarose gel. the the one-step AdvanSure RV multiplex real-time PCR assay and conventional multiplex RT-PCR assay were performed on 320 clinical samples simultaneously. a variety of clinical diagnostic assays have been the need for additional post-PCR processing of the samples. sensitivity of the AdvanSure assay demonstrated its clinical potential. the sensitivity of the conventional multiplex RT-PCR was 44.06% (141/320), while the sensitivity of the AdvanSure assay was 44.68% (143/320). the main advantage of the assay is the ability to identify 2 additional RVs not detected by the conventional RT-PCR assay, including hMPVs and HBoV. direct antigen tests or virus cultures cannot be completely replaced by multiplex PCR assays. the conventional multiplex RT-PCR kit used in this study featured a dual priming oligonucleotide system, but still yielded higher false-positive results.
